aws::graph::propositions: # Meteorological and Flight Information for Accident at Rocky Mountain Metropolitan Airport
The accident occurred under Instrument Meteorological Conditions (IMC).
The condition of light at the accident site was Night.
The observation facility was BJC at 5673 feet mean sea level.
The observation time was 21:28 Local.
The visibility was 1 mile.
The ceiling was Overcast at 600 feet Above Ground Level.
The wind speed was 5 knots.
The wind direction was 40 degrees.
The altimeter setting was 30.04 inches of mercury.
The departure point was Burbank, California (BUR).
The destination was Broomfield, Colorado (BJC).
The departure time was 17:45 Local.
Rocky Mountain Metropolitan Airport is located in Broomfield, Colorado.
Rocky Mountain Metropolitan Airport's identifier is BJC.
Rocky Mountain Metropolitan Airport's elevation is 5673 feet mean sea level.
Runway 30R was used.
Runway 30R is 9000 feet long.
Runway 30R is 100 feet wide.
Runway 30R's surface type is Concrete.
Runway 30R's surface condition was Snow and Wet.
The approach type was ILS (Instrument Landing System).
No VFR approach/landing was used.
The aircraft sustained Substantial damage.
There was no aircraft fire.
There was no aircraft explosion.
The accident location was approximately at latitude 39.93111, longitude -105.120002.
The crew consisted of 1 person.
The crew member was not injured.
There were 3 passengers.
None of the passengers were injured.
There were no ground injuries.
The total number of people involved was 4.
The total number of injuries was 0.

text:
# Meteorological Information and Flight Plan

## Conditions at Accident Site:
| Condition | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Instrument (IMC) | Condition of Light: Night |
| Observation Facility, Elevation: | BJC,5673 ft msl |
| Observation Time: | 21:28 Local |
| Lowest Cloud Condition: | Visibility 1 miles |
| Lowest Ceiling: | Overcast / 600 ft AGL |
| Wind Speed/Gusts: | 5 knots / |
| Wind Direction: | 40 |
| Altimeter Setting: | 30.04 inches Hg |
| Precipitation and Obscuration: | - |
| Departure Point: | Burbank, CA (BUR ) |
| Destination: | Broomfield, CO (BJC ) |
| Departure Time: | 17:45 Local |

## Airport Information
| Item | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Airport: | Rocky Mountain Metropolitan BJC |
| Airport Elevation: | 5673 ft msl |
| Runway Used: | 30R |
| Runway Length/Width: | 9000 ft / 100 ft |
| Runway Surface Type: | Concrete |
| Runway Surface Condition: | Snow;Wet |
| IFR Approach: | ILS |
| VFR Approach/Landing: | None |

## Wreckage and Impact Information
| Item | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Crew Injuries: | 1 None |
| Passenger Injuries: | 3 None |
| Ground Injuries: | N/A |
| Total Injuries: | 4 None |
| Aircraft Damage: | Substantial |
| Aircraft Fire: | None |
| Aircraft Explosion: | None |
| Latitude, Longitude: | 39.93111,-105.120002(est) |
